title: Self-Determination Theory-Based Project Design for Improving Procedural Task Instructions

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic work procedures and smartphone utilization skills
context.additional_context: Project-based learning in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, including procedural task simulations for solving community issues.

learning_goals: Learners maintain an 80% or higher participation rate when designing work procedures reflecting self-determination.
Learners reduce project errors by 30% by utilizing provided procedural selection options.
Learners identify autonomy elements in complex task instructions and propose three or more improvement strategies.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
